website_summaries.verdict: The flight-specific HyperX gaming headset for hobbyists and avid virtual pilots wanting the real experience.
pros: Headset features an extra long microphone that sits well in front of the wearer's mouth for clear audio pickup
Compatible with PC and PS4 gaming platforms
cons: Sound quality is not as clear and dynamic as other HyperX headset models

customer_reviews.title: Don't think, just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I don't write reviews but this headset is FREAKING AWESOME. Clear sounds, amazing quality of audio, and the microphone doesn't suck like the Logite...........yea that mic was really bad. This is very comfortable to wear, the padding is really soft and it holds your head really well. Setup was easy....just stick the USB dongle into a USB port, turn it on and BOOM! You got 30 hours of battery so you don't have to charge so often...or if you play for 30 hours straight which is bad for your health ;)
customer_reviews.author: Michael Zhao

customer_reviews.title: Well done HyperX
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is excellent Sound is crystal clear Microphone is good (no complaints from others) Headset range is excellent, ranges from my game room upstairs all the way down stairs to the kitchen (very imprortant) Mute bottom is well designed, on left ear cup Fits well on the ear Very light weight The only con to this headset is it heats up after consecutive hours of use, I find I can play about 2.5 hours of games before I notice it. Overall not an issue and totally worth the money, well done HyperX.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: The sound is good, the ear cups are comfortable and the mic ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The sound is good, the ear cups are comfortable and the mic works well. Battery life is acceptable. Cons: Much cheaper build quality compared to my HyperX Cloud Core gaming headset. I wanted a wireless headset and i waited for HyperX to build it but i expected the same comfort, fit, and build quality I had come to expect, but I did not get it. The price is way too high for what you receive. Too much plastic and too little comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Bad high pitch sound after every word or sound
customer_reviews.text: Pc usage for gaming... I let it charge fully before use, set it as default for mic and speaker in settings. Sound quality is okay, but there is high pitch tone after every word or sound, it’s really annoying and does not deliver to expectations. Will be either returning or exchanging these. I received an exchange unit and the sound is still present but I’ve gotten used to it now, also the battery life is terrible. I fully charged them and played for maybe 3 hours on 90% volume and no lights on and after I went to shut it off because I was finished playing I noticed battery life was on 25%!!
customer_reviews.author: stephano

customer_reviews.title: PS4 users ATTENTION
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality was amazing, the battery life was unbeatable, and most of all it was comfortable. Unfortunately when using with the ps4, the microphone was USELESS. It was extremely quiet and muffled. When you moved the mic closer to your face, the noise cancellation feature cut out 50% of your voice and you become inaudible. It seems MANY people are having this issue and only with ps4. I haven’t heard anything bad about pc use. If you are getting this for ps4 use, DO NOT BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Comfort.
customer_reviews.text: Much more comfortable than my previous headset (steelseries arctis 5). The wireless range is outstanding, no noticeable latency, and great battery life. I really enjoy the design and button layout of this headset. The only thing I would like this headset to feature is live microphone feedback. I don't mind that there's no software to manage EQ settings but this will probably bother other users. P.S True 7.1 surround sound on headphones doesn't exist so don't bother looking for that feature
customer_reviews.author: tim h.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but selective noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son and he says the sound quality is really great, but the noise cancelling seems to be a bit irratic. He can hear me when I let him know food is ready, or that I'm headed out for a bit, but these things seem to be able to block out every single time I tell him to take out the garbage or empty the dishwasher. He loves this particular feature, I'm a bit iffy on it myself
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gaming!
customer_reviews.text: Great for gaming!! Nice sounds! When I get shot, the sound totally startles me and brings me close to a real death! Just what I wanted!! Living to be old is overrated!! Build quality for the money is GREAT! Great battery life!! They are relatively comfortable and don't lead to any pressure issues. I wish they had replaceable ear foam pieces because I seem to eat these things up on my other headphones. Time will tell.. I will update if they let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Battery does not last..
customer_reviews.text: I've had this headset for maybe three months now, I listen at around 60% volume level. I usually can only get about eight hours of use with this before needing to throw it on charge. Considering I am using this at above half volume I'd maybe expect this to last 12-14 hours at this volume and I can't get that performance out of this. Sound quality is really good and Mic quality is pretty decent for this price point. But if you're going to use this for long gaming or work sessions, might wanna pass on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: I was using the sennheiser hd 598c's and absolutely loved the sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I was using the sennheiser hd 598c's and absolutely loved the sound quality. Though they lacked in directional sound at least for me. I was hesitant on purchasing another headset since i didn't want to go backwards so to speak in the audio quality realm. I was not disappointed at all with these. lightweight. AMAZING sound stage with exceptional directional sound. I would recommend these to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Bullzeye

customer_reviews.title: Search No Further, This is It!
customer_reviews.text: This headset is amazing. I went through about 6 headsets before this one and definitely recommend it. Don’t waste your time looking any further. I use this headset almost every day for about 2 hours, since I got it a few months ago. I rarely ever charge it, and even after a long time it doesn’t cause any discomfort. Never had it cut out or lag, connects immediately when the PS4 is turned on. Only thing I woukd like to see on a future model is a battery indicator of some sort (even though it has never died on me). It would be nice to work with my Xbox One too, but for the price you can’t best this headset.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Buly

customer_reviews.title: Won't Pair with dongle
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get this hunk of junk to pair. They require a small pin to push a button in a small hole to pair and don't provide the a pin to do it. I went to the store and bought paperclips and thumb tacks and it still wouldn't pair. Its a joke plz avoid these headsets. Big waste of Time! Whoever came up with the idea to put the button to pair the headset to the dongle in a tiny little hole should be fired. I'm starting to laugh at myself on how this headset has gotten me so angry lol. Will be returing this headset, to bad I can't get my time back.
customer_reviews.author: Jase D Cavanaugh

customer_reviews.title: Great battery
customer_reviews.text: The device disconnects often when used with a pc. That is my only complaint. The comfort level of these is a 4 out of 5. They squeeze pretty tight but I imagine they will break in eventually. So that should be fine. I have a pair of Astro a50 headphones and they have never failed me but there is a huge price difference. The battery life on these is pretty amazing! They last over 5 hours of actual play time. I have played on Them the following day and they still play for hours more. I don’t know exactly how long the battery will last but it is a good battery setup for sure.
customer_reviews.author: C.Beatty

customer_reviews.title: Could be better, especially for the price that ask.
customer_reviews.text: I had really high expectations for this product. As I read all about how great HyperX is. Yet these headsets under preformed. For the price, you’d expect a flawless item. Yet they didn’t manage to accomplish what they said they would. Don’t get me wrong, they are very comfortable and they sound good. Yet the mic is horrible. I would constantly be getting cut off mid sentence. It got so annoying, and frustrating. So I decided to return them the same day I received them. Look elsewhere for a better product. Until I see HyperX mention they fixed or upgraded their flaws, I’ll purchase them again. Till then no thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Nico Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable AF
customer_reviews.text: A great headset for wireless gaming. Upgrading from a pair of wired Logitech headset and will never go back. Although The build quality is plastic, they feel secure on my head and don’t have a very cheap feel. Sound quality is great, mic quality is average. Which is a loss of a star. Headset appears to be closed back, so sound isolation is decent. The best thing about this headset is the comfort. This head set feels similar to the padding on Bose QC 35s, but most likely is a “fake” leather. Regardless, this headset is super comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Mac Cortez

customer_reviews.title: Comfy headset
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable headset I've used. I wear glasses and this is the very few one that actually I can wear for a long time. I've tried highend audiophile headsets, the sounds is a bit better (not audiophile) but still not comfortable. I've tried Arctis 7 but still my ear/head hurts only after 30 minutes. The only issue I have is, this does not have sidetone ( -star) , so when you speak, you can't hear yourself. You kinda get used to it after a while.
customer_reviews.author: A. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Decent Headset
customer_reviews.text: This wireless headset isn’t bad. It’s a bit overpriced, but all wireless headsets are right now. Noise-cancelation is decent, but not that great. Sound quality is nothing special. Mic quality is actually pretty decent for a wireless headset, but it still sounds like a wireless headset mic. Was kinda disappointed with how often it needs to be recharged, as it was advertised as being able to go without charge for 30 hours, yet it starts beeping to charge it after a little over 8 hours of usage. Overall, it’s a decent headset. Probably not worth the full price tag, but worth getting on sale or for a cheaper price somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Doherty

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great range, great build
customer_reviews.text: These are built well and are comfortable to wear. They have really good range and I haven't had any interference when using them close to the usb dongle. The mute is kinda weird, I can't remember if 2 beeps or 1 beep is muted. The volume knob moves in 4% increments, which kinda sucks. I wanted 2% increments. Often the difference between comfort and pain is like 16% vs 28% volume. I've only really used these for talking + music so I can't comment on their surround sound or in-game capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Rob C

customer_reviews.title: Critical Flaw
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are good and all. They serve their purpose when doing everything wirelessly however there is a critical flaw. They cannot be used when charging. When I'm connected wirelessly I plug them into re-charge and all sound goes dead. Also, the microphone only works in wireless mode. You can still use the headphones in a wired mode via the 3.5mm jack but then the microphone does not work defeating the whole purpose of a headset. I guess these are TRUE wireless because once they're wired they do not work. I think I'll stick to wired headsets from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W

customer_reviews.title: Long range and battery life
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a month. As long as you have dry wall, these go pretty far. I can listen to them on the other side of my house (about 35 ft). As soon as I cross my cement wall outside I lose connection. Battery life is really around 16 hours. The beeps let you know how much charge is left (75,50,25%). I leave it charging overnight. Sound quality is good, but not as good as wired headphones. Definitely can notice the bass missing on these. For me it being wireless is more important though. Volume can be very loud.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Polo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with Zoom Meetings
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it 5 stars but it won't work with a zoom meeting. I'm in them daily due to the pandemic. I go to college online right now and I really needed something that worked with EVERYTHING. Otherwise, it's a great headset. In games, watching movies, etc, there is no lip-sync lag. Likely because it has its own Bluetooth adapter. I haven't tried it on any other video conferencing format so I don't know if it works with Skype, but since it won't work with Zoom I imagine it will not be compatible with other video formats.
customer_reviews.author: Catiera Shaw

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS HEADSET!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this headset last year, it worked for a couple days and then the power save settings started malfunctioning and it would turn off mid sentence whether it was fully charged or not, I contacted HyperX 3 friggin times to get some dang customer service to either get my money back or a new one and they never contacted me back at all, terrible customer service and I am out the money for the headset now and having to buy a new one despite mine still being in warranty because they refuse to contact me back, will never buy a HyperX product ever again!
customer_reviews.author: Kiria

customer_reviews.title: Support is terrible for when this eventually breaks
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this pair of great headphones for over 3 months. 3 weeks ago my microphone stopped working. So I began the incredibly long slog through support to get a replacement. 12 emails, 6 photos of the product sent to support and 3 weeks later. I get the RMA support person from some kingston email with the RMA# referenced hidden in my other emails. Way to go in pissing off the most patient customer. Save the box, start support early because this is a long journey you have started. Terrible experience.
customer_reviews.author: M. Beezy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good sound but a bit loose though
customer_reviews.text: I like the sound quality(Bassier Sounds) a lot better than my old razer headset. However, there is a faint noise coming from the headset but I'm sure that inevitable with wireless headsets. The headset is a bit loose for my head and I'm an average-sized person but looseness comes with comfortability which my old set did not come with if I were to wear it for a 9-hour workday. Haven't tried the mic but it's probably abysmal like all headset mics. I wish the port to charge was USB-C though, c'mon man who still uses micro-USB.
customer_reviews.author: Marites Becles

customer_reviews.title: Get something els!
customer_reviews.text: These are not worth what you pay. The ps golds are better for real. Not loud at all and you dont have separate controls for game and chat volume. That's what's making get new ones I liked the way there made and the quality of them just not the function that the crappie part of them. I've been hearing good things about the logitech's so ima give those a try and yes they do have separate volume controls yay.
customer_reviews.author: Vapin clowds

customer_reviews.title: Only reason it’s not a 5 star is because of durability
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this headset, and is probably in my top 3 favorites of all time. The only thing that holds this back from a 5 star is the durability. Where the headphone connects to the headband there is basically no reinforcing and just straight up plastic. This can result in breaking, as it did with me. Not even a month in, I was plugging it into the charger when it slipped out of my hand and fell to the floor where the headphone discombobulated from the actual headband, which is irreparable. The durability is really what holds this headset back, otherwise it’s a definite 5 star
customer_reviews.author: Nate Lawson

customer_reviews.title: EDITED: Microphone pops rendered my device unusable after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: One week review, See edit below. I packed up my yeti, removed the DAC from my desk, and now I’m using this headset as my daily driver. It’s not going to deliver the crispest audio ever. It’s not going to be the best recording quality for your voice. It is quite useful for hobbyist gaming. Do recommend. Edit: Bought in Late December, the microphone now appears to be dying after 3 months time. There's loud popping and hissing when I speak and that's made it impossible to enjoy gaming with this headset. Welcome back, DAC.
customer_reviews.author: Brb

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, but don't use on PS4 if you want to use the mic.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great overall. The sound is great, they are lightweight and super comfortable. I was very excited to use them on my PS4 for gaming. Unfortunately, I play a lot of games were in-game communication is essential and the mic on this headset just doesn't do it. It constantly cuts out and is unable to pick up my voice every few seconds. My friends can barely understand what I am saying which is very annoying. I have tried two of these headsets and the same problem occurs which sucks. I will be returning both pairs for this reason which is unfortunate because most everything else about these headphones is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I used it for maybe a week.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for PC Gaming... The negative...The battery life isn't 30 hours more like 10-12 hours. I had a lot of people complaining about the mic, there wasn't that much bass. It sounded like I was in a wind tunnel when i wasn't listening to anything. The positive...Was it was wireless so there was no cord in my way and I wasn't ripping my keyboard and mouse off the desk when I got up. It might be better for consoles.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Sinnett

customer_reviews.title: No sidetone / mic monitoring
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice headset, but because I'm an idiot I had to return them. I bought them assuming they had sidetone, because I asked someone I knew that had them if it had sidetone and they said yes... After the headset arrived I quickly discovered that my friend did not know what sidetone was. It was very comfortable and the sound was really good. The mic is really good too, according to my friends. I was really tempted to keep this set, but I really don't need more than one for talking with friends, and without sidetone or open backed, it's a bit too uncomfortable for me
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: What a great headset! My last one was the wired version, but I always seem to wear out the lines so I spent the extra cash on wireless. My only issues is that I have to tell my computer to switch from my speakers to the headset and sometimes I have issues with my games not automatically recognizing that. I also have a tendency to turn off the mic by accident (pressing the left outer ear cup) and not realizing it, but I don't use the mic that often. The sound quality is pretty awesome, I'm glad I gave them a try.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa C.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Microphone, Leather earpads are stifling.
customer_reviews.text: I use this gaming headset on discord and when i put the microphone away my friends hear my voice very low, if I put it nearby they can hear very loud my breathing, i configure the Mic Sensitivity in discord but it does not work very well, to give an example the razer carcharias have better microphone despite being so old, and better earpads. I don't know why manufacturers still using leather for earpads for long gaming sessions which become a hell because of the heat and little breath what gives that material.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian

customer_reviews.title: It was okay
customer_reviews.text: I bout my friend an Arctis 7 which has twice the range and can plug it into a phone and still use the mic. This cant (I knew that already) But for a wireless headset and not having range is kind of dumb. Though I have the same headset as this but wired and its just as conferrable which is a lot better than other headsets, normally I get headaches from other headsets. This, like its wired counterpart, does not give me headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Ham

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and sounds right
customer_reviews.text: Microphone works well, and the audio is great. Battery life seems appropriate. The only gripe I have with these is the location of the volume wheel. It does brush up against a collar and adjust the volume from time to time. The detachable microphone is nice, however it would have been better if it was retractable. I scramble to find, the plug it in correctly right when I'm about to game :) Friends say I sound as good as I do in person. I hear them just fine, and fell these have a good range of tone.
customer_reviews.author: A. Halpert

customer_reviews.title: Decent Quality Wireless Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Extremely comfortable, Durable, and easy to use and setup. Cons: Battery doesn't last near as long, the sound quality isn't great compared to the other products offered by HyperX. There is feedback at times, but that is also dependent on where you are in your home and the other devices around you. Overall, these headphones are by no means bad, but for the price, it's just better to get the HyperX Revolver S. I had those before this set, but I wanted to try their wireless headphones. I'm not completely sold on the quality overall, but I am still a massive HyperX fan. I've owned this headset since October of 2019.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless gaming headset
customer_reviews.text: this is my favorite headset! i have 3. 2 are wired. this is my only wireless one. i was hesitant to buy them cause someone had said you cant use them while charging BUT that is a lie!! i have definitely still used them while charging and still able to use the mic during gaming. the mic is actually pretty good considering most wireless gaming headsets have terrible microphones. however i have no complaints with this one. cancels out background noise very well without compromising mic volume for yourself. i would definitely recommend this to anyone that is looking for a good gaming headset
customer_reviews.author: jon woods

customer_reviews.title: All around decent - an audio perspective
customer_reviews.text: Bass is accentuated but this Headset isn’t fatiguing to listen to (unlike Steel Series, which is way too bright sounding). This isn’t going to beat a wired connection, their revolver headsets sound considerably better and more balanced, but the convenience and comfort of this headset is superior.
customer_reviews.author: Aetoss

customer_reviews.title: Mic doesn't work on ps4
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, sounds great easy to setup on PS4, lasts a long time very comfortable had them on for hours no pinching or ear compression. Pretty legit for the price, had to change to one star after on PS4 the mic constantly cuts in and out or I'm incredibly quiet, after doing research it appears hyperx is aware of the problem but hasn't done anything to resolve the issue. Won't be purchasing a hyper x product again. Huge waste of money if the microphone doesn't even work for gaming on the platform it's advertised for.
customer_reviews.author: Jank

customer_reviews.title: One of the best wireless headphones for gaming
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were purchased due to my loud roommate and the no wire factor for gaming. At first, I was skeptical, but it performed much better than expected. Sound quality is nowhere near as good as wired headphones like Sennheiser, however, for wireless headphones, it's amazing. One of it's greatest pros is the weight, it's light enough for you to forget that the headphones are one your head, however, the plastic build quality scares me sometimes as I feel I could break these headphones really easily. However, overall it's a solid product and a worthy investment if you don't want to deal with removing headphones everytime you need to do something.
customer_reviews.author: Jian

customer_reviews.title: As a Hyper X Cloud 2 User
customer_reviews.text: I am comparing the Hyper X Cloud 2's to the Flight. I had purchased the flight because it was wireless and I wanted something that feels comfortable that I can walk around the house in. Unfortunately when used for an extended period of times it felt extremely hot and uncomfortable. I returned and stuck with the Clouds. These are by far the most comfortable noise cancelling headsets that I have purchased. The wireless in my opinion was not worth the lack of comfortability especially during a long gaming session.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: The most uncomfortable headphones I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: These are awful on your ears. I don’t know how anyone used them. The sound, sound quality is nothing to brag about and only upside is that it’s wireless. Software is useless for these headphones so no point in downloading it as it’s just go volume control and mute which you can do on the headset alone. I ended up dropping extra dollars and getting Logitech pro x. I now use those for gaming AND work. Hours a day and I don’t need to take them off or adjust
customer_reviews.author: Jovan

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this headset to anyone who prioritizes comfort, bass, and battery life
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Amazing sound and bass for a wireless headset -Noise cancellation is amazingly underestimated. Had my phone playing music right next to me and someone talking to me and none of it went through to my friends playing online. -Battery life -Most comfortable headphones I have ever used (Especially compared to the death grip of the Arctis 7s and Arctis wireless) Cons -Having to re-adjust the headset volume AND lighting effects everytime you turn on headset. -Lack of equalizer/customization
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at the quality
customer_reviews.text: I use these for gaming / discord mostly. I was not sure if sub $200 headphones would be any good, but so far I am really liking these. They fit very well on my ears, the battery lasts for hours, the mic is removable and the whole left side of the headphones is a mute button in case you are using voice activated. Only down side is the receiver dongle is giant, so I don't use it on my work laptop, but on a gaming tower is hidden in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Poppy

customer_reviews.title: First impression: impressed
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading from the Plantronics Gamecom 780. These have great, comparable sound quality to those, but are so much more comfortable! The pads aren't as soft as Bose, but I can wear these all the time and have no pain or discomfort. I hope they last a long time. Some things I discovered after buying them: - can be plugged in to 3.5 mm devices male-to-male - turn off automatically after no use for a while - take a few hours to charge fully - bluetooth has amazing range (25+ft) - not bad without equalizer, so not upset by the lack of HyperX headset software
customer_reviews.author: ATN

customer_reviews.title: High quality and reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: Wireless connection is very stable Great sound quality Ear cups are a bit on the smaller side. It is perfect for my wife's ears (5' female) but would be a bit small for mine (6' male) They are priced competitively with other fully wireless gaming headsets. The removable mic is a nice touch. For those that arent using voice chat often it is convenient to have it detatched. Overall I am very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price tag
customer_reviews.text: Build quality, software quality, and sound quality not great for the price. Would be more acceptable for a headset in the $50 range. Definitely don't get 30 hours of use on a single charge, and have had some issues with charging overall, with the headset sometimes not charging at all. Disappointed with the appearance and quality of materials. Finally, while I don't consider myself an audio enthusiast, the sound quality is noticeably poor. I often notice some odd vibration noises coming from the earcups while listening to music, playing games or watching videos. Overall, there are definitely better options in this price range, and this is a disappointing product from an otherwise great brand.
customer_reviews.author: Blzrnnr1

customer_reviews.title: Highly satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Have had these for 3 months now and use them almost every day. I always overlooked wireless headphones mainly for the charging part of it but after going through numerous wired headsets and breaking every pair from the cord getting caught in my chair wheels, I really wanted a wireless pair that had a long battery life. I charge these once every few days even with playing numerous hours. I personally don't use the mic because I have a blue snowball so I cant really say anything on that part but everything else about these headphones has been perfect so far. Hope they last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Alex G.

customer_reviews.title: Hyper dissapointed in my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Good until they are not. This pair of headphones was a good pair of wireless headphones that worked pretty well for about 16 months and then the right earcup became detached and started to hang. HyperX makes their headphones with this weird silicone material that doesn't last. The material is very brittle and breaks after awhile. I owned the HyperX Cloud Revolver S prior to this and the same thing occured the silicone material broke and the headset went with it. HyperX headphones are probably the most comfortable headphones out there but they don't seem to stand the test of time and last. For $100 I think headphones should last at least over 2 years, very dissapointing.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: best hyperX headset i've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this one after the HyperX cloud 2 for the portability. the sound quality is even better, the range is insane, and the battery life survives multiple days of long play sessions if you turn the light off. highly recommended ~Edit~ hyperX as a company is some of the best customer services I've ever had. i had my dongle get destroyed in a scramble at home and they replaced it for free, no questions asked. thank you for being awesome HyperX!!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Heklowski

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming headset but with one drawback
customer_reviews.text: So I really like this headset with its awesome sound and it really does have good noise cancellation. The only drawback is that you can't hear yourself. I've tried turning it on in windows but its lags behind my actual voice so I end up hearing my words a split second after I say them which is weird so I had to turn it off. Other than that, it has amazing battery life and no problems whatsoever. I'll probably get used to not hearing myself but it's probably not for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Allen T

customer_reviews.title: Better headsets out there
customer_reviews.text: Seeing all these great reviews and I'm honestly confused. The headset feels fine on your head. The problem is the wireless capability. I couldn't walk around my room without it disconnecting even after charging it for hours. I had less issues with a turtle beach from years ago than with this. A friend bought the same headset and the sound quality over any call coming from that headset is terrible. It sometimes lowers your voice down even after turning off sound adjusting options in any app we used. Overall I hated it. The price should be lower than $50 for this headset.
customer_reviews.author: GaryFnOak

customer_reviews.title: Good for the first year
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for about a year and a half now. They work great but more recently I have been having quite a few issues with them. While talking to my friends they often complain that the mic cut out and they didnt hear what I said. I often experience them cutting out, crackling and sometimes they sound like I am under water. I use these primarily for gaming and while the sound is very good in these, the product failing after just a year and a half with not much wear on them does not make me happy. Noise cancellation is very good but not perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Boden Sundeen

customer_reviews.title: Battery doesn't last more than 2 hrs
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get these headphones due to the detachable microphone but the battery on these headphones doesn't last up to 30hrs as stated. After I have charged the headphones for some hours, it just dies within the next 2hr. It's a bummer that I need to recharge these headphones a few times a day. Other gaming headphones I used to own, they would last me all day and just need to recharge one or every other day.
customer_reviews.author: Han

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I use this for gaming. My computer is rather loud when the fans spin up and the microphone manages to compensate for the background noise really well. Headphone sound is crisp and clear. Volume is crazy loud. I have it set at about 25-30% and I can hear everything just fine. Battery life is slightly less than advertised, maybe 25 hours with the lights turned off. Overall, it's a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphones
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my partner as a birthday gift. Easy to say he loves these headphones. I did a lot of researching and reviewing. These headphones are everything I expected and more. He's able to play so much better because of the sound clarity and location. They are comfy and completely cancel out outside noise. (Kinda sucks because now I can't talk to him while he's gaming lol) but it's really great! I hope this review helps someone who is on the fence on which headset to purchase. I would suggest watching YouTube videos as well.
customer_reviews.author: ashley hill

customer_reviews.title: Sound Leaks, Needs re-pairing each firmware update
customer_reviews.text: I cranked the audio up to see what how much sound leaks, it was basically a mini-speaker, When i updated firmware i was at an absolute loss on how to re-pair the headset, ended up on reddit with the hyperx staff saying "find a paper clip and push the tiny button hole on the dongle" I was appalled to acknowledge that there really was no tool they provided for this function. They made such an annoyingly small hole and expect you to push the button each time? what if the button malfunctions with different objects!? Disappointed in that design. Other than that i'm satisfied with the sleekness, will update on the wear-ability of the headset for heaviness and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Kristian R.

customer_reviews.title: good sound quality, medium comfort
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphones. Not quite as loud as the HyperX wired, which is minor since I never have the volume up all the way anyway, but also less comfortable and a lot hotter, with limited battery life and long recharge times. I much prefer the wired HyperX headphones, which are just about the most comfortable extended-use headphones I have ever worn, but for times when wireless is a must these work quite nicely. I don't regret purchasing these at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ivko Cvejic

customer_reviews.title: Just one complaint
customer_reviews.text: HyperX in my experience makes all their headsets squeeze in on the ears from the side a little intensely. Hurts my ears a little after long use. It's worth noting that I wear glasses. The top band is very comfortable. All in all happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua James Flanders

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Headset
customer_reviews.text: The headset hava a lot of good things, any gamer that needs a wireless headset will be delighted. Good things: - Long batery life - Comfortable - Easy to connect and it can be used while charging. - Detachable mic - it feels strong and durable Things that can be improved: - Type C connector - If it is used while charging, heat can be feel on ear - The software to control the headset is slow and ugly. Also, the headset lights can be turn off from the software.
customer_reviews.author: Andrés Brais

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. They are generally not bad for the price, but neither I nor my teenage son could game with them very well. If you use the virtual surround sound it becomes very noisy and impossible to tell where sounds are coming from. So I have to leave that off. And being closed they get hot fairly quickly. Found a nice pair of open back headphones that work much better. Kept these as backup and for guests.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not up to par
customer_reviews.text: I'm a streamer...audio quality is important. I got this headset thinking it should have a good enough mic and audio quality to be comparable to my hyper x that was wired from best buy from 8 years ago...boy was I wrong. Wireless drivers compress your voice and sound much worse. Headset audio sounds okay, but not where they should be. This headset does "work" but if you're going from a 200+ wireless headset or even a 100+$ wired one to this...expect a downgrade in quality.
customer_reviews.author: ALPHA420KING

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned the HyperX Cloud II before upgrading to the Cloud Flight. Personally, I like the more minimalistic design of the Cloud Flight than the Cloud II. If you had the Cloud II and enjoyed the comfort of it, you will enjoy using the Cloud Flight as well. Very comfy. As far as sound quality, it is very similar. Very good bass and treble. However, with the microphone, I did find that the Cloud II has better quality than the Cloud Flight. But that doesn’t mean the Cloud Flight is bad, it’s still great for what it is. Overall, I purchased these headset for the conveniency. No wires attached and I love every second of it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: John Tuq

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound and battery life
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound and battery life. Range is good but not through walls so much. Big downer with this headphone is that it turns it's self off to conserve battery. This is a big issue if you are using these to answer calls/work. To keep it from turning off just play some music in the background on your pc. The audio will keep it alive.
customer_reviews.author: eric carney

customer_reviews.title: Nothing great, average at best; returned
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and the Arctis 7's at the same time. It's no comparison between the 2 for gaming; The Arctis 7's blow these away in every aspect except for comfort. The 7-channel directional audio of the Arctis 7's is miles ahead of the Cloud Flight's. Plus, the Arctis 7's have a retractable mic and a dedicated chat/game volume rocker adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: rob damiani

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless headset
customer_reviews.text: HyperX never disappoints. I needed a wireless headset and first tried the Sony products. The Sony Golds were terrible, cheap, and the static noise hurt my ears. Then I tried the Sony Platinums, which were decent, but overpriced. The Platinums would also cut off after walking a couple steps away and I’d have to reset everything. Finally I tried the HyperX (I didn’t know they had a wireless version). These are amazing. Comfortable, sound quality is great, the mute feature is also nice. These are also cheaper than the overpriced Sony Platinums. I will always buy from HyperX from now on.
customer_reviews.author: D.Moises30

customer_reviews.title: Best Headset & Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Hyper X headset I have purchased over the last five years for myself and family, there customer service is amazing for example, I lost my mic during a move and email them to purchase a new one, guess what! they sent me one at no charge at all. Don't pay any attention to the other negative reviews, I go multiple days without the need to recharge and the clarityis amazing. Totally recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Scrat

customer_reviews.title: Good overall
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for better performance compared to cheap computer speakers. Sound quality is quite good, however isn't extraordinary. I do not use the microphone, so it is nice that it is removable. Cordless feature is also a massive plus. The fact that they run on battery power has not been an issue after a few months of moderate use and periodic charging. Ears get hot after an hour or so of wearing, however cools somewhat quickly or remains cool if you take them off for a bit periodically.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Best Hyperx headset I've used
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after the hyperx cloud alpha II. Both are great, but this is a step above. Sound is better, sound isolation from external noises are way better, microphone is equivalent. This will really last 30 hours on one charge (not at full volume). Max volume on this is much louder than the wired cloud alpha, so no need to run max volume unless you don't like your ear drums. If this failed, I would absolutely buy another one, amazing headset.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: The Hyper X Cloud Flight, the right choice.
customer_reviews.text: This hyper x cloud flight headset has to be one of the best gaming headsets out there. I have tried other headsets like steelseries arctis 3 and the hyper x cloud stinger, but the cloud flight is the best of them all. It is wireless and you could use it wired. I use it wired with the quadcast and it still works amazing. I give this headset a 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: deing

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review
customer_reviews.text: i have had these headphones for some months now and my previous review was 4 stars. Im changing it to 2 for two reasons. 1) the left side adjustment has come very loose and does not hold its position anymore. 2) the battery life has gone way downhill. I completely charged them yesterday and without more than maybe 6 or 7 hours of use with the LED's off im already getting the low battery sound. I am really disappointed because i loved these so much to begin with, a bit of a letdown honestly especially at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Silas

customer_reviews.title: Really comfy, clear sounds but
customer_reviews.text: I really like this headset. It is really comfy to use it all day long. The control buttons on are very useful. The design is great and being able to remove the microphone when not in use is great. However, I use it to teach and when I lecture, if no student speak up then it turns itself off every 15ish minutes. There is no way to control that and for that reason I have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Bossus Maryline

customer_reviews.title: Microphone doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Very frustrating experience, scores of people online having the same problem (just search, you'll see). Microphone doesn't work. Updated to the latest firmware, didn't help. Can hear sound but nothing from the microphone, even though Windows 10 detects it. Tried reaching Kingston support, help the phone for 15 minutes before giving up (probably saved me from more frustration as I'm guessing this is a hardware issue that can't be troubleshooted). Tried to online chat and waited another 15 minutes, no reply. Poor support, poor product. Company has gotten too big and too diversified. Buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sean_O

customer_reviews.title: Better than Arctis 7
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after returning Steelseries Arctis 7. This doesn't squeeze my head like the Arctis 7. Flight is very comfortable and can be placed at many positions. Works very well with FPS games, music, podcasts, and watching YouTube videos; however, I do wish there was an indication that the mic is on mute. Also, PS4 will shut off the headset if you are just using the mic and not the earpiece. I'm assuming an idle issue?
customer_reviews.author: imlawrencehi

customer_reviews.title: loud white noise
customer_reviews.text: Has a loud white noise when turned on, has nothing to do with the usb dongle because they made the noise when the usb was not plugged into my computer. The firmware update did nothing and when audio is played it take a while for the white noise to stop but its so loud when audio is not being played. Was looking forward to this headphone but my god I can't stand the white noise. The turtle beach wireless did not have this problem. Might stick with them or try another company.
customer_reviews.author: Ashish Patel

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't match with its description that well
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty good headphone if your using it for just listening music or playing games for 5 hours straight but definitely not longer hours of usage. Especially for me because I purposely bought it for gaming purposes and it said "up to 30hrs" for it to last upon usage but definitely don't last for up to double digits hours (not even 10 hours), plus the mic isn't that good as my friends couldn't hear me that well after I adjust it 4 times. Please improve the battery life and the mic.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Great headset
customer_reviews.text: It’s not noise canceling but if your girlfriend is talking you won’t hear here. Long bat life. Good comfortable feel not too compressing and I have a big head. Like the side buttons and auto shut off feature that seems to work when you hang them up or leave them laying down somewhere. Easy to use. Bought it like new from amazon to save 60 bucks and was well worth the save. Came in like new packaging
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life is a lie
customer_reviews.text: The battery life for this headset is absolute garbage. It is advortised that with the led's off and at half volume the headset can last for 30 hours but in the real world you should only expect about 10 hours. I love the audio quality and the noise cancelation of these headphones and was sold by the long battery life but I am utterly disappointed in how HyperX lied to their customers about the longevity of the battery life and how on long gaming sessions your wireless headset turns into a wires one as you have to plug it in to charge while playing then.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Good headset, but hurts ears after a while. Also, the headset randomly turns off for no reason.
customer_reviews.text: Headset is great. Very good audio. Only offset is the muffs hurt my ears after 1hr+ of gaming where as other headsets in the market range do NOT. Noise cancellation is spot on though. Lastly, for some wierd reason...the headset will randomly TURN OFF. Which is annoying when I'm playing a competitive game with friends. Headset fully charged too. Wierd. Might return because IDK if I got a faulty head set or not. Would be 4 stars minimum if it werent for the fact that it randomly shuts off on me. Makes it annoying because I have to constantly turn it back on.
customer_reviews.author: Torry Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless headset on the market
customer_reviews.text: The HyperX Cloud Flight is one of the best wireless headsets out there (that I've tried). I retired a Sennheiser Game One + GSX 1000 Amplifier for the Cloud Flight as I was super impressed when I used them for the first time. I was kind of worried about sound output / quality as other wireless headsets that I've owned in the past just don't have anything to them and I have some hearing loss, so these are great considering sometimes I have to turn the volume down. I mainly use these for PUBG, Hunt: Showdown, Black Ops, WoW and they have pretty decent surround as well. I definitely don't think you'll be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Horrible popping noise from interference
customer_reviews.text: Probably going to return my second pair that I got as a replacement. the interference is annoying it will pop every once in a while and is rather annoying. This has been a complaint by many on many sites now that I am googling it. Wish they would fix this. This is the worst headset I have ever ordered I have gone back to wired because I can get a very good quality headset in the same price range.
customer_reviews.author: Spiff

customer_reviews.title: Woke
customer_reviews.text: Best headset I have ever had. I had no idea the difference a good headset makes or what I was missing out on. When i put these on my head for the first time, I was woke. Felt great and sounds great. Battery life is amazing for how often I use them.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Pedigo

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless headset
customer_reviews.text: Swapped out my Logitech G933 wireless headset for this. So far I love this in comparison. Sound is great, mic quality is better/clearer, and battery life last alot longer. Headset was plug and play which is nice in comparison to having to download the Logitech driver I'm used to. The mute button is nice, but wish there was just one customizable button so that I could map a push to talk button to my headset. I got this on sale for 70-80$ and was definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wireless
customer_reviews.text: I went from a Logitech G633 to this and the mic quality is a bit lower but barely noticeable. And the wireless battery is amazing. Defiantly worth the upgrade. The only negative is that you should just a USB extender to move the USB adapter they give you to put it in front of your desk or somewhere visible not hidden to increase the range. Once I did that I was able to go everywhere in my apartment besides outside it with no issues!
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Wife started a grease fire, didn't even hear the screaming!
customer_reviews.text: My wife was cooking fish, and apparently the oil got way too hot and lit on fire. I say apparently because I didn't hear as the flares went up; I was wearing these headphones. When my wife and children were screaming in terror at the flames erupting throughout my kitchen, worried we would lose our livelihood or worse amidst the blaze, I was blissfully playing Escape from Tarkov and pwning noobs. I could've died and I wouldn't have even noticed until the fire was already upon me - 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a faulty pair? Headphones not charging, mic not working after 1 week
customer_reviews.text: These headphones worked for the first day but after I had to charge them they started acting up. Not charging, beeping continuously, the mic started not working. Very disappointed for as expensive as these were and the great reviews I really thought they would be better then this...customer service can you clear this up? Maybe a faulty pair?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's modular. I have yet to figure out the bluetooth feature on it but I can plug it into my PS4 controller. I like that the mouthpiece is modular and can be detached. The ear pieces are very soft and don't pinch my head. It also seems that the only way to charge it is through the device it's plugged in vs. a wall charger. Product could be improved upon but bang for my buck, I like it and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Dj

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not great
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent for a wireless stereo headset. Not great for big heads. It is on the ear instead of over the ear, so if you wear glasses you're going to feel some angst after a bit. Fantastic battery life, but you can't turn off the LEDs on the cups to increase battery life or reduce obnoxiousness. Also, no simulated surround sound for PC. It's pretty minimal and overpriced at $100+ for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Klingbeil

customer_reviews.title: Great headset, could use a larger battery.
customer_reviews.text: Great headset, no setup needed. Switched from Kraken 7.1 to this and this headset definitely has lower bass. It took some getting used to but I got used to it and now can’t tell the difference. Works for gaming, music, youtube, movies, anything. In my search for a fully wireless setup this was a great additition. You will need to charge it often, battery lif is its biggest weakness. I bought a magnetic head charging cable and it may seem like a small thing but those 2 seconds saved have really improved my enjoyment of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, great audio quality
customer_reviews.text: HyperX always has the most comfortable headsets and this new wireless one is no exception. I first bought a headset that was twice the cost and on every top 10 list - it was horrible and rock hard. This one is a dream! I highly recommend trying it out and the audio quality is great. I also usually have them on anywhere from 2-10 hours depending on gaming/homework and have had them I think almost two months
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Great Product with small design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the headset is in ok working order. I have notices that when i turn my head, the volume scroll up/down hits my shoulder so every once in a while when i move, the volume changes. If you have broad shoulders are 'High' shoulders, I wouldn't recommend it. One other thing i noticed is that the battery doesn't last as long as i thought it would. Im working from home due to Covid and the battery does not last me the day :/. I am happy with the head set, just needs a couple tweaks on the next model.
customer_reviews.author: Nonarac

customer_reviews.title: Speakers in headset go in and out, and are mostly out now.  No one can hear me talk anymore
customer_reviews.text: After working from home with this headset since March, I'm giving up. At first they worked OK, maybe 80% of the time. They've degraded since, which is degrading me to having to ask on every single conference call, "Can you hear me? Can someone come off mute and say something so I know my headphones are working?" It's usually either the mic or the speakers. And then it's a scramble to redirect my ZOOM or TEAMS or GOTOMEETING app to a little backup USB speaker on my desk, leap up to turn my fan off, close my door and suffer heat exhaustion. Don't buy these. Please don't buy these. You were warned.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: OK headset.
customer_reviews.text: The headset itself provides good sound, especially for games like Counter-Strike where I need to hear the foot steps. Listening to music is pretty awesome as well. I listen to a lot of heavy metal and I can hear every instrument clearly. My real and only complaint is within 1 week of using the headset, the microphone port on the headset became extremely loose. During a game of GTA5 online, it dropped the detachable microphone to the floor randomly and ever since then, my mic doesn't work on this headset. I plugged it into a different headset and it works..Probably won't buy this headset again next time I'm shopping for one.
customer_reviews.author: Katie R

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Headset!
customer_reviews.text: Great headset! With the current work from home due to Covid-19, many people I work with also bought this same headset. Everyone is very happy with the quality and comfort. The noise cancelation is great when on video calls as well. I have a unique perspective on my review because so many people on my team have this same model so I can give feedback from both ends of the user experience. No complaints at all
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Beed

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for glasses-wearers, excellent battery life
customer_reviews.text: I wear glasses, and tried a few other headsets looking for one that didn't cause pain around my glasses. This set is lighter than others (Logitech 533, for example) and has enough padding to avoid pain for at least 3 hours. I stretched them out for a day before using them, so take that into consideration. I would prefer a better/larger volume control, but overall, I am pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: G. Cracker

customer_reviews.title: Didn't replace my beats but....
customer_reviews.text: These are nice. Was a little tight so if you wear glasses, probably not a good option. Just tight enough it starts to hurt after 30 mins. But they are worthy trying if you can catch them on sale. Be careful and don't plug the Mic into the headset speakers, this will destroy the speakers. And if after you're 30 days is up your SOL.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Good Wireless Headset
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality could be better it's mediocre but a decent headset at least is very comfortable and sounds very clear when I talk to my friends which is a huge plus! And when I'm just strictly gaming by myself that's when the sounds is a lot better HUGE UPDATE This Headset is Awesome did some tweaks and the sound quality is finally good I'm loving this Headset I highly recommend it now I finally figured it out!
customer_reviews.author: Juni

customer_reviews.title: Wish they were better
customer_reviews.text: Great audio quality, horrible build quality. Microphone stopped working after a month, had nothing but issues connecting it to various computers. I tried to get a replacement but there's no way to contact the seller. $100 kinda wasted. I'll change my review if I can get my hands on a set that actually works. Just my $0.02.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Horn

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I bumped lightly the usb signal receiver and it broke, it is very cheaply made. I attempted to purchase another one and hyperx is out of stock, and doesn't know when they may get more. With out the usb receiver you cannot use the headset and microphone. Its absurd to have a cheaply made piece, that easily breaks, and you cannot replace it, warranty or no warranty. I suspect its out of stock, because of how often it breaks. Do yourself a favor and buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great headphone but bad mic
customer_reviews.text: The audio quality is fantastic and doesn't fit too tightly over my head. However the mic quality is mediocre at best. I've had cheaper microphones that work better than this. It catches all the sounds of you breathing when you pronounce words with "p" sounds. Recently my microphone has been acting up even though I've only had it for 3 months. It stopped picking up my voice as effectively and had sensitivity issues even though I didn't change anything in the settings. Tried fixing it but nothing helps. Reached out to the sellers a couple weeks ago but they never responded to my message. Poor customer service
customer_reviews.author: SSC

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after lite use
customer_reviews.text: Headphones cut out. have terrible RF or Bluetooth connection whichever it is. Station is 2 feet away and they drop conection and turn off constantly. I do not recommend these. The microphone stopped working already and they plate connection on them is shorting out. These were bought on sale, I would not recommend even wasting the $60.
customer_reviews.author: Brn Miller

product_meta.title: HyperX Cloud Flight - Wireless Gaming Headset, with Long Lasting Battery Upto 30 hours of Use, Detachable Noise Cancelling Microphone, Red LED Light, Bass, Comfortable Memory Foam, PS4, PC, PS4 Pro
product_meta.description:
Style:Flight| Pattern Name:Headset

Escape the limits of cable connections and roam free with the wireless HyperX Cloud Flight. With a solid, gaming-grade wireless connection, incredible 30-hour battery life, and signature HyperX comfort, Cloud Flight allows you to play uninterrupted for longer. The closed cup design helps keep you immersed, while the durable steel slider and high-quality construction mean it’s built to withstand daily wear and tear. This headset is PC, PS4, and PS4 pro ready with a 2.4GHz wireless connection. The ear cups rotate 90° to rest comfortably around your neck during breaks, and feature convenient controls for LED effects, mic mute, power, and volume. The detachable noise-cancelling mic helps ensure that your communications are heard crystal clear, and Cloud Flight has been certified by TeamSpeak and Discord.

Features:

Headphone: 
- Driver: Dynamic, 50mm with neodymium magnets 
- Type: Circumaural, Closed back 
- Frequency Response: 20Hz - 20,000Hz 
- Impedance: 32 ohms 
- Sound pressure level: 106 dBSPL/ mW at 1kHz 
- THD: <2% 
- Weight: 300g 
- Weight with mic: 315g

Microphone: 
- Element: Electret condenser microphone 
- Polar pattern: Noise-cancelling 
- Frequency response: 100Hz - 7000Hz 
- Sensitivity: -45dBV (0dB=1V/Pa, 1kHz)

Battery Life*: 
- 30 hours - LED off 
- 18 hours - Breathing LED 
- 13 hours - Solid LED 

*Tested at 50% headset volume

Wireless Info: 
- Band: 2.4GHz 
- Range: Up to 20 meters** 

**Wireless range may vary due to environmental conditions

Audio and Mic Controls: 
- Volume wheel located on the bottom of right ear cup 
- Pressing the left ear cup mutes the mic 
- Single button for power and LED selection 
- Audible indicators include: Power, Battery Life, Mic Mute, and Volume Min/ Max

Package Contents: 
1x HyperX Cloud Flight 
1x Detachable Noise Cancelation Microphone 
1x USB Charging Cable 
1x USB Adapter.
feature_bullets: Gaming grade 2.4GHz wireless connection, with up to 30 hours of battery life
Signature HyperX comfort and immersive in game audio
PC, PS4, and PS4 Pro ready
90° rotating ear cups with LED lighting effects
Intuitive on board audio and mic controls
Detachable noise cancellation microphone - microphone engineered to function only when in wireless mode and only on PC and PS4
